edu.berkeley.compbio.sequtils.strings

Interface SequenceSpectrumScanner

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    KcountScanner

    public interface SequenceSpectrumScanner
    Provides an interface for classes that can scan sequences to count the occurrences of substrings
    Version:
    $Id: SequenceSpectrumScanner.java 477 2009-07-18 00:46:23Z soergel $
    Author:
    David Soergel

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SequenceSpectrum getEmpty()
      Returns an empty SequenceSpectrum of the appropriate type.
      SubstitutionFilter getNucleotideFilter() 
      SequenceSpectrum scanSequence(SequenceFragment fragment)
      Scans a sequence to count pattern frequencies.
      SequenceSpectrum scanSequence(SequenceFragment fragment, byte[] prefix)
      Scans a sequence to count pattern frequencies, considering only words that follow the given prefix.

    • Method Detail

      • getEmpty

        SequenceSpectrum getEmpty()
        Returns an empty SequenceSpectrum of the appropriate type. This spectrum is "empty" in the sense that it is not based on any sequence, but it may nonetheless represent some prior, e.g. uniform.
        Returns:
        an empty SequenceSpectrum of the appropriate type.

      • getNucleotideFilter

        SubstitutionFilter getNucleotideFilter()

      • scanSequence

        SequenceSpectrum scanSequence(SequenceFragment fragment)
                              throws IOException,
                                     FilterException,
                                     NotEnoughSequenceException,
                                     com.davidsoergel.stats.DistributionProcessorException,
                                     com.davidsoergel.dsutils.GenericFactoryException
        Scans a sequence to count pattern frequencies.
        Parameters:
        fragment - the SequenceFragment providing the sequence to be scanned
        Returns:
        a SequenceSpectrum containing the counts of all patterns being scanned for
        Throws:
        IOException - when an input/output error occurs on the reader
        FilterException - when the scanner is filtering the sequence while reading it, but the filter throws an exception
        NotEnoughSequenceException - when the reader cannot supply the desired amound of sequence (some scanners may not throw this exception, but instead simply return a Kcount based on the short sequence)
        com.davidsoergel.stats.DistributionProcessorException
        com.davidsoergel.dsutils.GenericFactoryException

      • scanSequence

        SequenceSpectrum scanSequence(SequenceFragment fragment,
                            byte[] prefix)
                              throws IOException,
                                     FilterException,
                                     NotEnoughSequenceException,
                                     com.davidsoergel.stats.DistributionProcessorException,
                                     com.davidsoergel.dsutils.GenericFactoryException
        Scans a sequence to count pattern frequencies, considering only words that follow the given prefix. Primarily used for multi-pass scanning, to achieve a large effective word length within reasonable memory.
        Parameters:
        fragment - the SequenceFragment providing the sequence to be scanned
        prefix - the word that must precede each pattern in order for it to be counted
        Returns:
        a SequenceSpectrum based on words immediately following the prefix
        Throws:
        IOException
        FilterException
        NotEnoughSequenceException
        com.davidsoergel.stats.DistributionProcessorException
        com.davidsoergel.dsutils.GenericFactoryException
